Add.Content:
How to Insert a Flash Movie into a Page

While inserting images is supported out-of-the-box in Composite C1, inserting a Flash movie requires that you install our free Flash-support module. This page explains how to use the Flash-support module. But since website developers may prefer other techniques for handling of Flash content, don't be surprised if your own C1 solution takes another approach.

To insert a Flash movie:

  1. Edit a page where you want to insert your Flash movie and click the Content tab.
  2. Click Insert, Function and select Composite.Media.FlashViewer.



  3. In the Function Properties, select the Flash File you want to insert, specify the Width and Height of the embedded movie on the page.
  4. Optionally, you can also choose whether you want the movie to Repeat playing and indicate the Flash Version to use.
  5. Click OK and save the page.

When you preview the page, you will see your Flash movie being played.

Working with Tools

C1 perspectives may be associated to a set of Tools, in which case a button on the main toolbar will light up. A click on this button reveals the contents of the toolbox. By default, Composite C1 ships with two tools for use on the Content perspective: The Page Browser and the SEO Assistant.

How to Insert Text into a Page

Text from Word can be inserted on a page, but should be “cleaned” first.

  1. Click Paste from the menu and click From Word.

  2. The following dialog will appear:

  3. Paste the text you want to copy into the dialog and click OK.

The text is now inserted into the page.

If you want the text to be cleaned completely, you should use the As Simple Text instead. When text is inserted in this way, all formatting is removed completely.

NivoSlider Gallery Example

This is an example of using the Composite.Media.NivoSlider package to present images in an image slider. For more information, please see the Composite.Media.NivoSlider package documentation.

Tags

Archive

Sitemap

Developer tip: The sitemap above is rendered by the same Function used in the footer quick navigation menu, Omnicorp.Navigation.Sitemap. By specifying input parameters to the Function, the same Function may be used in different scenarios. In this case, the parameter Levels instructs the footer menu only to display two website levels.
How to Insert a YouTube Video into a Page

Developer tip

As the list of news grows longer, it may be necessary to break it up on several pages.

On the news-XML function call, two fields may be modified to support this easily:

page size
page number

How to Publish a Page

When you have created a page and feel satisfied with its content, you can publish the page to the website.

  1. Right-click the page you want to publish in the page structure.
  2. Click Publish in the context menu.

If you click Send For Publication, the page will be published after it is approved by the user with this permission.

To unpublish the page:

  1. Select the page you want to unpublish in the page structure.
  2. The toolbar will now display a new menu command called Unpublish.
  3. Click Unpublish and the page will no longer be displayed on the website.

How to Use the Page Browser

Page Browser is a built-in C1 tool that helps streamline your editing activities as well as instantly locate and manage pages.

With the Page Browser you can browse your entire website right in C1. As you move from page to page, the corresponding pages get selected in the Content Navigator. You are always aware of what page in the Content Navigator you are currently viewing in Page Browser.

And not only this - each time you browse to another page, not only does the proper page in the Content Navigator get selected but also does the toolbar show the buttons relevant to the page you are currently viewing.

(click the image to view it enlarged)

How to use Page Browser:

  1. Open Page Browser from the Tools menu. It opens on a separate tab in the working area. By default, Page Browser opens the homepage of your website.
  2. Browse your website in Page Browser by clicking links on pages or typing URLs in the address bar.

As you can see, the page you are viewing in Page Browser has been selected in the Content area and toolbar buttons are all relevant to this very page.

Instant Editing

As it was mentioned earlier, Page Browser allows you to edit or manage pages instantly, while you are browsing.ll you need to do is to browse to the page you want to edit and click Edit Page - and the very page you are viewing in Page Browser will open in HTML Editor.

How to instantly edit pages with Page Browser:

  1. Open Page Browser from the Tools menu.
  2. Browse to the page you want to edit.
  3. Click Edit Page on the toolbar. The page you are viewing opens in HTML Editor on a separate tab.
  4. Edit and save the page.

We mean business

Launch Composite C1

Thank you for trying the Composite C1 demo website. It is intended for users who want to get a quick overview of C1 features and possibilities.

To get started, browse the website - as your prospective visitors will do - using its menus and links to get a quick impression of what Composite C1 can bring online for you. This is only one of many “looks and feels” you can possibly create with C1. Everything is customizable: website structure, layouts, colors, fonts, data presentation just to mention a few. Learn how quick you can create a website - by reading our User Manual.

To give you an idea of user roles and permissions you can set, we introduce 3 different user roles you can access the demo website with.

With the End User role, you can create, edit and publish web pages as well as upload and use different media files on the website. Don’t miss the SEO Assistant tool that allows you to optimize the pages for search engines.

As the end user, you will primarily work with the Content and Media areas. Use the following credentials to log on:

  • Username: enduser
  • Password: 123456

If you are all for dynamic content, you should try the Advanced User role. With this role, you will be able to create various data types and use a host of rendering functions with the data type items for your dynamic website.

As the advanced user, you will primarily work with the Content and Data areas. Use the following credentials to log on:

  • Username: advuser
  • Password: 123456

If you are an XML /XSLT or C# expert, you will certainly appreciate the programming possibilities C1 provides the Developer role with. Various templates will handle the website layouts and “looks and feel”. With the XSLT functions, you can render and transform both the website content and appearance in many possible ways.

More of a C# developer? Create your own C# functions to manage the data and its presentation on the website. Or you can go as simple as creating your own Visual Functions, an intuitive and fast way of learning how to develop for C1 – doable even for beginners. How about extending the C1 functionality? Make use of the repository of C1 packages that add even more value to C1.

As a developer, you will primarily work with the Layout, Functions and System areas. Use the following credentials to log on:

  • Username: developer
  • Password: 123456
Search

How to Add a Style to a Page

The C1 website developer may associate one or more CSS class name to any element on the page. This will allow you to change the visual styling of the element with a few clicks of the mouse. On this website, two class names have been associated to the table element.

While one of the styles suits a multi-purpose table with lots of text:

Question Answer Notes
What exactly does Omnicorp produce and/or sell? We synergize professional resources by no-nonsense facilitation of global business infrastructures. Business is booming.
How can I apply for a job at Omnicorp? You can't. We have no public job listings. If you are talented enough, Omnicorp will hire you eventually. We will contact you on your home address.

- the other one is more suited for numbers and currencies. In the table below, the right-aligned text makes it easy to compare figures:

Company Seasonal turnover Increase in turnover
Omnicorp 23.500.100.864,00 1.103.255.023,50
Tropical Office 2.023,00 -523,50

Let's see how this works:

  1. In the Visual Editor, create a new table (see how to insert a table).
  2. Select the table using the status bar:

    • Place the cursor inside a table cell.
    • In the status bar, click the word table to select the whole table:


  3. This will activate the class name selector on the Visual Editor toolbar, allowing you to choose a different style for the table.



  4. Select one of the class name in the selector, for example, text. The table will change the way it looks.

Developer tip

The same Function, Omnicorp.Content.News, is used to render the news list, the news archive list, the news story subpage and the front page news teaser.

The Function uses PageID to determine, where on the site it is being shown. This can minimize the need for user configuration.

As an alternative, basic news list functionality is provided by an installable C1 module.
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head></head> <body> <f:function name="Omnicorp.Content.News" xmlns:f="http://www.composite.net/ns/function/1.0" /> </body> </html>

How to Preview a Page

When you have inserted content on a page, you can open to the Preview tab and view how the page will look on the website.

This can be done even though the page has not yet been published to the website.

(click the image to view it enlarged)

Developer tip

The search functionality is provided by a slightly modified version of the installable C1 module, SimplePageSearch

The module searches through page content, titles and descriptions.

To search structured data, you must use an advanced search engine as detailed on Docs.

Privacy statement

Using Composite C1

Composite C1 is 100% web-based and is accessed through Internet Explorer or Firefox. You open your browser, log on with your username and password and you will then be able to insert content on your website.

After you have logged on, the Composite C1 administration console opens in your browser. It consists of two main areas: navigation areas and the working area.

(click the image to view it enlarged)

On the left, different navigation perspectives are placed. The website is both built and maintained through the same administration console, but the various tasks are organized under separate perspectives. For example, all pages are placed under the Content perspective and all tasks concerning user administration and permissions are placed under the Users perspective. The perspectives are:

  • Content
  • Media
  • Data
  • Layout
  • Functions
  • Users
  • System

The right side of the administration module consists of a working area from where the content on the website is administrated. When an element, like a page, is selected in the navigation area, the fields belonging to this element will be displayed in the working area. Depending on the selected type of element, different kinds of editorial possibilities will be displayed in the working area.

To each area there are context sensitive toolbars and menus. When you select an item, the toolbars will only show the menu commands associated to the selected item. When you select an item, and right click, a menu will appear. These menus will typically contain more menu commands than the context-sensitive toolbar at the top.

The Content perspective is the most used perspective for editors. This perspective contains the pages of the website arranged in a tree structure that reflects the structure of the actual website. Pages at Level 1 in the tree structure are typically shown in the top navigation on the front-end. Pages at Level 2 in the tree structure will typically be shown as the sub-navigation on the front-end. Depending on the actual design there are an infinite amount of possibilities for sub-navigation structures.

Use the menu on the left to learn how to create, edit and publish web pages as well as optimize pages for search engines.

How to Insert an Image into a Page

Images can be inserted on the Content tab of a page.

  1. Click Insert from the menu and click Image.

  2. The following dialog will appear:

  3. Select the image you want to insert.
  4. Click OK.

The image is now inserted on the page.

Working with Pages

There are two different types of content management systems (CMS) – page-based and item-based. Composite C1 is a page-based system, which visually gives you a 1:1 relation between pages in the administration module and the pages on your website. This means that when you create a page in Composite C1, you create a new page on your website. Use the menu on the left to learn how to create, edit and publish pages.

Developer Tip: In addition, Composite C1 allows you to work with structured data and thereby reusing content, which is the main advantage in the item-based systems. On this demo site, the News section has been implemented by use of structured data.

Terms of use

Information contained within the tutorials and code samples on Omnicorp's website can be used in whatever manner you wish, without attribution.

How to Insert a Table into a Page

Tables can be inserted in the Content area of a page.

  1. Click Insert from the menu and click Table.
  2. The following dialog will appear:

  3. Specify how many columns and rows you want the table to have
  4. Click OK.

The table is now inserted on the page.

To edit the table further, use its context menu:

  1. Place the cursor in the table and point to Manage Table in the context menu.
  2. Using this menu you can insert new columns, rows, split and merge cells and so on.

How to Upload a Media File

When you want to insert an image or a PDF file on your website, you will first have to upload the file to the system. You can do it in the Media area of Composite C1. You can create the folders you need to organize your images and other files.

  1. In the Media area, select the folder where you want to upload a new file to.
  2. Click Upload File on the toolbar.

  3. The following dialog will appear:

  4. Select the file you want to upload and click Finish.

The file is now uploaded to the Media archive and you can use it on a page .

How to Use SEO Assistant

Search engine optimization (SEO) is the process of improving the volume or quality of traffic to a web site from search engines via "natural" ("organic" or "algorithmic") search results.

When you insert content on your website, it is important to make sure that the pages are optimized for search engines. This is to ensure that your visitors and customers will be able to easily find your website using a search engine, for example, Google.

Composite C1 has the SEO Assistant tool that can give you some guidelines about how well the individual pages are optimized for search engines.

SEO Assistant has two tabs. One tab is for displaying results and the other tab is for your keyword list. The keyword is a global list where you can insert as many words as you like. The words that you insert on the keyword list should be words that you would like to enhance on your website.

How to insert words on the keyword list:

  1. Open SEO Assistant from the Tools menu.
  2. Click the Keywords tab.
  3. Place the cursor in the white area and type in the words you want to enhance on your website.
  4. After typing each word, press Enter.

  5. When you have inserted the selected words, click the Save button.

The best way to optimize your website is to make sure that there is a single page fully optimized for each of the words in the keyword list. SEO Assistant tests if keywords are present in 6 different areas.

These are the Title, URL, menu title, description, Heading and the content area. With SEO Assistant you can test one page at a time.

How to optimize a page for search:

  1. Open SEO Assistant.
  2. Select the page you want to test.
  3. Click Edit in the toolbar and click the Preview tab.
  4. When Preview is selected, the results for each of the keywords present on the current page will be displayed on the Result tab.
  5. If you click the Expand button (“+”), you will see which areas of the page the word occurs in. The green checkmarks indicate that the word is present and the red cross that the word is not present.

  6. This gives you a quick overview of how well the selected page is optimized for the chosen words.

If you click a word in the result list, it will be highlighted on the Preview tab.


(click the image to view it enlarged)

Developer tip

To improve readability of this page, the developer has included a CSS stylesheet to render text in columns. Note that you need a modern browser to see this effect.

By including stylesheets, individual pages may present unique layouts without introducing new website templates.

To insert stylesheets or scripts on any page, edit page content and switch to "Source" mode.
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head></head> <body> <f:function name="Omnicorp.Content.News" xmlns:f="http://www.composite.net/ns/function/1.0" /> </body> </html>

Working with Media

The content on a website includes not only plain text and links to other web pages or websites. Most likely, you will see images and be able to download various files such as PDF documents or ZIP archives by clicking links. Very often, you will see Flash movies. With the advance of web technologies and popularity of YouTube and the like, quite a few websites embed different types of streaming video in its web pages. All this is media, and you will certainly use it to enrich the content of your web pages.

For this purpose, C1 has a perspective called Media where you upload all your media files. It consists of the Media archive, which displays all the uploaded media files that can be used when you are editing pages from the Visual Editor. Once your files have been uploaded to the archive, read on for instructions on how to insert an image and insert a Flash movie.

<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head></head> <body>
<f:function name="Composite.Community.Blog.BlogRenderer" xmlns:f="http://www.composite.net/ns/function/1.0" />
</body> </html>

Omnicorp projects

YouTube Video Example


This is an example of using the Composite.Media.YouTube package to embed and play a YouTube video. For more information, please see the Composite.Media.YouTube package documentation.

Developer tip

To improve readability of this page, the developer has included a CSS stylesheet to render text in columns. Note that you need a modern browser to see this effect.

By including stylesheets, individual pages may present unique layouts without introducing new website templates.

To insert stylesheets or scripts on any page, edit page content and switch to "Source" mode.

How to Create a Page

In this section we will examine how to create new pages.

  1. Select a page in the page structure.
  2. Click Add Page on the toolbar.
  3. Fill out the requested fields:
    1. Enter the Page Title and the Description
    2. Select the Template for the page
    3. Select the Position of a page
  4. Click Finish.

The new page is now created and content can be inserted.

The new page can have 3 or 4 page tabs and a variable number of content areas. The structure on the page depends on the template it is based on.

(click the image to view it enlarged)

If a page has more than one content area, users can switch between these areas from the selector on the right side under the Content tab. It is easy to switch between the different areas, and each content area has the same editorial possibilities.

How to Move Pages

If you have already created a page, you can easily move it. You can also move whole sections of pages.

  1. Right click the page you want to move in the page structure.
  2. Click Cut in the context menu.

  3. Right click the page under which you want to move the page to.
  4. Click Paste in the context menu.
  5. Select where you want to paste the page and click OK.

You have now moved the page.

How to Edit Content on a Page

Content on pages is inserted on the Content tab. The Content tab contains an HTML editor which offers you many editorial possibilities and can be viewed upon as a small text processing tool. There are a number of opportunities for text editing, insertion of images, links, tables and so on.

To edit content on a page, follow these steps:

  1. Select a page in the page structure.
  2. Click Edit Page on the toolbar.
  3. Select the Content tab. Now you can use the HTML editor to insert or edit your content.

(click the image to view it enlarged)
